items.title: Mark's Routine
items.text: I am Mark. I work in a busy office in Manchester. I start work at 8:30 AM. First, I check my emails and answer the important ones. At 10:00 AM, I have a meeting with my team. We discuss our daily tasks. I use a laptop and a printer every day. I finish work at 4:30 PM.

vocabulary.definition: Full of activity.
To talk about something with another person or group.

items.explanation: Extracting routine details from a personal narrative.

items.title: The Hotel Team
items.text: Sarah and Paul are receptionists. They work at the front desk of a hotel. They greet the guests and answer the phone. They use a computer to check the reservations. They speak English and Spanish. They work from 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM. They like their job very much.

vocabulary.definition: A person who greets visitors and answers phones.

items.title: Office Hours
items.text: Our office has a new schedule. We start work at 9:00 AM. We have a short break at 11:00 AM for coffee. We have lunch at 1:30 PM. We finish work at 6:00 PM. On Fridays, we finish early, at 4:00 PM. We love Fridays!

items.title: Administrative Tasks
items.text: I am an administrative assistant. My daily tasks are very organized. I write reports for the manager. I email the suppliers for prices. I organize the files in the archive. I call the clients to confirm meetings. I am very busy but I enjoy my work.

A place where historical documents or records are kept.

items.title: IT Support
items.text: The IT team works in the basement. They use very powerful computers. They fix the servers and help employees with password problems. They work 24 hours a day in shifts. There is always someone in the IT room. They are very important for the company.

vocabulary.definition: The floor of a building which is partly or entirely below ground level.
Scheduled periods of work for groups of people.

items.title: Monday Meetings
items.text: Every Monday morning, we have a general meeting. All employees participate. The CEO speaks about the goals for the week. We drink coffee and eat some biscuits. The meeting lasts one hour. Then, everyone goes to their desk to start work.

items.title: Paperless Office
items.text: Our office is green. We don't use a lot of paper. We scan all the documents and save them on the server. We send emails instead of letters. We recycle our trash. We want to protect the environment. We are a modern company.

items.text: In the afternoon, the office is quiet. People write reports and organize their desks. The phone doesn't ring much. At 4:00 PM, some people drink tea. At 5:00 PM, everyone prepares to leave. They turn off their computers and lights.
